main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted in Madrid, Spain on 22 August 1955, observed by a USAF Major who reported hearing a jet sound and then saw a white spherical object.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a weather balloon but then appeared to change in shape from a sphere to a disc before disappearing from sight.
The sighting lasted between one minute and 15 seconds to one minute and 30 seconds.
The weather and visibility at the time of sighting were clear with unlimited visibility and no wind at ground level.
The witness, a senior pilot with approximately 4,000 hours of flight time, stated that he had never observed or reported such a phenomenon before.
Investigations revealed a balloon release by British forces, which the witness may have observed, along with the presence of two F-86 aircraft in the area at the time of the incident.
result: Prosaic explanation as a balloon release by British forces is suggested, along with the presence of two F-86 aircraft in the area at the time of the incident.
sighted object: Unidentified spherical and disc-shaped object in the sky
witnesses: USAF Major and some Spanish nationals
